subject: Productivity
title: Dopamine and Repetition
description: A short lesson to help you apply Dopamine and Repetition.

hook.text: Dopamine is often called the pleasure chemical. That's a simplification â€” it's really about wanting.

buildup.text: Dopamine signals which actions are worth repeating. It's a prediction chemical, not just a reward one.

discovery.text: When an action delivers more reward than expected, dopamine surges. The brain marks it for repeat.

twist.text: When the reward matches expectations exactly, dopamine stays flat. Surprise drives learning.

climax.text: This is why novelty fades. The first bite of cake excites dopamine; the tenth does not.
